Being reliable means others can count on you.
A reliable person is dependable. A more specific definition of reliability is consistency in performance or behavior. In other words, a reliable person can be counted on time after time.
The most important way of being reliable is by following through on commitments. If you give your word, people expect that you will do what you say.
Reliability is a character trait that seems less important to some people than many of the other traits.

Reliability is used in everyday speech to describe persons or things. A reliable person can be counted on, hence a reliable employee turns up for work on time and performs assigned duties to the best of her or his abilities.
Reliability is also used to describe a particular quality of the numbers obtained by measuring the characteristics of person or things.
Reliability connotes a kind of consistency.
A person who does as promised can be considered reliable. Reliability is an admirable characteristic.
The reliable person feels good knowing that he or she is trusted.
Being considered reliable means that you are conscientious and keep you promises. A reliable person does not make excuses.
The benefit of being reliable is that people trust you and feel the can count on you. A reliable person will get and keep friends much easier than someone who is careless in personal relationships.
So yes, reliability is certainly part of impeccability. Doing the very best you can do at all times. It is also speaking your truth, isn't it? Reliability is also a shamanic trait.
Keeping your promises is a key of being trustworthy. When you make a promise to someone, you create a reason for that person to rely on you.
When you make an important promise to yourself, you also have an obligation to fulfill it.
